definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Make curtains of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle-eleven altogether.
sentences.chinese: 你要用山羊毛織十一幅幔子，作爲帳幕以上的罩棚。

sentences.english: The curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
sentences.chinese: 殿裏的幔子，從上到下裂爲兩半。

sentences.english: And the curtain of the temple was torn in two.
sentences.chinese: 殿裏的幔子從當中裂爲兩半。

sentences.english: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction: and the curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.
sentences.chinese: 我見古珊的帳棚遭難，米甸的幔子戰兢。

sentences.english: And the veil of the temple was rent in twain from the top to the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 殿裏的幔子，從上到下裂爲兩半。

sentences.english: At that moment the curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
sentences.chinese: 忽然殿裏的幔子，從上到下裂爲兩半。

sentences.english: They made curtains of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle-eleven altogether.
sentences.chinese: 他用山羊毛織十一幅幔子，作爲帳幕以上的罩棚。

sentences.english: who stretches out the heavens like a curtain and spreads them like a tent to live in.
sentences.chinese: 他鋪張穹蒼如幔子，展開諸天如可住的帳棚。

sentences.english: And thou shalt make curtains of goats' hair to be a covering upon the tabernacle: eleven curtains shalt thou make.
sentences.chinese: 你要用山羊毛織十一幅幔子，作爲帳幕以上的罩棚。

sentences.english: 38The curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.
sentences.chinese: 殿裏的幔子從上到下裂爲兩半。

definition: tabernacle (biblical word for a meeting hall or tent)
variant of 帳篷|帐篷[zhang4 peng5]
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
Epistle of St Paul to the Colossians
variant of 撒旦[Sa1 dan4], Satan or Shaitan
